name: Melasti Beach Ungasan
address: Indonesia, Bali, Badung Regency, South Kuta, Ungasan, Unnamed Road
review 1: the location is not far and not too crowded. the beach is clean, we didn't see many trash around. but there are quite a lot small stone and shells so must be careful when walk along the beach or when you play in the water especially if barefoot. the view is stunning. the water is clear. many people play water and swim in the shallow part of the sea. whenever sea is in low tide, there are natural barrier between the shallow water and the sea, so it is safe to swim because the high wave hit the barrier and go back to the sea. the ambience is peaceful and we were so happy just sitting around and feel the sea breeze
review 2: Nicely made beach with parking right in front of the beach. The place has many sitting area for families and friends to enjoy the beach activities and have a lovely picnic. They also have two private beach clubs with no minimum charges which is good to grab drinks and enjoy infinity pools facing the beach. The place is in south of bali hence no good sunsets. But the weather is really pleasant and chill.
review 3:
Melasti Beach Ungasan is a stunning beach in Bali, boasting soft white sand, clear turquoise water, and dramatic cliffs framing the scene. It's no wonder it consistently receives high ratings. However, to give you a fully honest and real review, there are a few things to consider:

The good:
Beautiful scenery: The beach itself is breathtaking. The combination of the white sand, clear water, and cliffs creates a picture-perfect postcard scene.
Great for swimming: The water is generally calm and clear, making it ideal for swimming and enjoying the waves.
Developing infrastructure: Compared to the past, the access road to Melasti Beach has improved significantly, making it easier to reach. Additionally, several beach clubs and restaurants have opened up, offering various amenities and dining options.
Photogenic spot: The beach is a popular spot for photography, especially during sunsets, offering stunning backdrops for capturing memories.

The not-so-good:
Limited shade: With minimal natural shade options, be prepared to bring an umbrella or rent one from the beach vendors.
Can be crowded: The beach's popularity can lead to larger crowds, especially during peak season and weekends.
Limited public facilities: While some beach clubs offer amenities like changing rooms and showers, public facilities like restrooms may be limited, especially outside the club areas.
Descent can be challenging: Reaching the beach involves descending a long flight of stairs (around 500 steps). This can be difficult for individuals with limited mobility or those traveling with young children or elderly people.

Overall:
Melasti Beach Ungasan is undeniably beautiful and offers a great experience for swimming, relaxing, and enjoying the Balinese scenery. However, be aware of the potential downsides like limited shade, crowds, and the descent before you go. If you're looking for a secluded and quiet beach experience, Melasti Beach might not be the best fit. But if you're okay with these factors and prepared accordingly, you're sure to have a memorable time at this stunning beach.
review 4: The approach road to this beach is amazing specially from White Rock Beach Club side. Clear and pristine beach having few of amazing beach clubs like White Rock, Karma Kandara and Sunday beach club. Amazing place for photo shoots as well and great for swimming as well.
review 5:
üö∂ I walked down to the beach, but it‚Äôs quite steep and about fifteen minutes, so please be careful if you struggle with mobility. Definitely opt for a car.

üèùÔ∏è The beach is mostly rocky, but it‚Äôs still pretty. There is a little outcropping where you can stand to get photos, and there is an unmarked area which juts out to form the southern most tip of Bali. Definitely visit!

üçπ The beach clubs are obscenely expensive, with one asking for 250k for a seat. Nope. I went to Minoo which was okay, but for example, a coke was 60k as opposed to 10k in stores.

üöï Don‚Äôt fall for the taxis, they will over charge you and Grab works just fine at the bottom despite what they say.

üì∏ Please be aware that I was approached by lots of Muslims girls and boys who wanted a photo with me. I was not at all offended and was happy to do so with a big grin on my face, but please be aware of this before going if you‚Äôre uncomfortable in photos. However, conversely, please be kind and patient with them because they were all so lovely.

name: Tropical Temptation Beach Club by Ini Vie Hospitality
address: Melasti Beach 88, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
First off, the staff is incredible.  Like, ridiculously friendly and helpful. They made sure I had everything needed for a perfect beach day. Speaking of perfect, the cocktails here are next level--seriously, everything on the menu looked amazing.

But wait, there's more! The food? Oh. Em. Gee.  We shared the brisket and some burgers, and let me tell you, this is where the real magic happens. The portions are huge, the flavors are INSANE, and the prices are on point!
review 2:
We ended up paying 1.5mil for two here while seeking refuge from a sudden downpour. Had so much to eat n drink. The food taste was generally satisfactory, and we enjoyed the double trouble pasta.

The club pool was nice. The added convenience of a secure area to leave our belongings while we head down to Melasti beach was a plus. Service was good.

All in all, albeit a bit expensive, we had a fun n memorable time
review 3:
Had an awesome day at Tropical Temptation!  The staff there were super friendly and helpful, always there to lend a hand (or recommend a killer cocktail). Speaking of cocktails, theirs were on point, but honestly, the real MVPs were the food.  We tried the brisket and burgers, and let me tell you, our taste buds did a happy dance. Huge portions, delicious flavors, and all at a decent price. You can't beat that!

Plus, the view? Amazing. Just stunning beach scenery everywhere you look. And the music? Totally bumping! Great energy with strong beats that just make you wanna move.

Overall, if you're looking for a fantastic beach club experience, Tropical Temptation is the place to be. It's perfect for beach bums and anyone who needs to unwind and soak up some good vibes.
review 4: Beautiful area, can not fault how breath taking the venue is, I however felt like it was definitely overpriced, poor service  as I had to ask for things multiple times before our table got them. The guy who served us after a change of staff definitely bumped the rating a Star up. Security could have done a  better job at handling people who were way too drunk instead of leaving them to get worse before kicking them out.
review 5: Tropical Temptation is a beach club gem! üíé The staff is amazing, providing incredibly kind and helpful service. The view of the blue sea is breathtaking, adding to the perfect beach club experience. A must-visit for anyone looking for a relaxing and enjoyable time by the sea! Also Melasti Sunset was so refreshing üèñÔ∏èüåä

name: Pantai Melasti
address: 554Q+PJ5, Jl. Pantai Melasti, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
One of the cleanest beaches we visited in Uluwatu, with super clear blue amazing water.

The rental of the bed is quite expensive comparing to other beaches, but it was worth it IMO.
review 2: I went to Melasti Beach at the end of October, at the end there was Melasti Beach which spoiled me with beautiful views of the cliffs and beaches. I was lucky that day the weather was sunny and I enjoyed the beautiful views of the cliffs and Melasti Beach.
review 3:
I went to Bali at the end of October and visited Melasti Beach

You can find coral and sea animals there

the weather is hot at 01:00-02:00 am
the situation is a bit quiet

I enjoy enjoying the scenery there by taking photos together
review 5: it was really hot when we went here but its a nice place overall

name: M√Ønoo Beach Club
address: Jl. Pengayutan. Pantai Melasti, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: It was a great place to chill for the day. The drinks are good, and not terribly overpriced for a beach club. There is a 300k minimum you have to order if you want  a beach table and umbrella but you can easily hit it with a couple cocktails. Super relaxed place and in the club there‚Äôs a pool and all the beach club shenanigans. Waiter also super chill and the bartender made my drink as I like it (super strong)
review 2:
Nice beach club, really love the foods and drinks ‚ú®
The staffs are nice and helpful.
There‚Äôs pool here, but not sure if there‚Äôs a min charge if you want to use it.
Great place to enjoy sea view and relaxing vibe beach club üòé
review 3:
Good place, good food and good staff!

No entrance fee, only minimum spend depending on the table that you choose, super worth it with all the quality they gave.

Highly recommend for you guys
review 4: Good place to bring your family & friends, kids friendly beach club, kids allowed to swim on the pool.. there is kids menu & access direct to the beach, not too crowded or noisy, and have shadow areas. No entrance fee, only minimum spend depending on the table you choose. If you forgot to bring your own towel you can rent for Rp.25k.
review 5: I went to this beach a few days ago, the food was very good and I had a lot of fun with my friends!!! I especially loved the view of the beach üòØ Bali is amazing as always!! ü•∞

name: Kecak Dance at Melasti Beach
address: 5527+P5G, Jl. Melasti, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
Witnessing the Kecak Dance at Melasti Beach was an unforgettable experience that beautifully showcased Balinese culture against a stunning ocean backdrop. This traditional dance, performed at sunset, created a mesmerizing atmosphere as the rhythmic chants of the dancers and the dramatic setting sun combined to tell a powerful story from the Ramayana.

The location on Melasti Beach added a magical element to the performance, with the sound of the waves complementing the dancers' chants. The natural amphitheater of the beach allowed every seat to have a clear view of the performance, ensuring all attendees could fully immerse themselves in the spectacle.

The Kecak Dance itself is a visual feast, with a large group of performers creating a lively, pulsating circle around the central fire. The dance is not just a performance but a spiritual experience, reflecting the rich cultural tapestry of Bali.

For anyone visiting Bali, this experience is a must-see. It‚Äôs not just about watching a dance; it‚Äôs about feeling a part of Bali‚Äôs soul. Highly recommended for an evening of cultural immersion and scenic beauty.
review 2: One of the best experience to watch this dance show. This is based on Ramayana Story. They work very hard to show you the story. Entrance ticket for 2 was Approx. Rs. 1500/- i booked it online via klook. The timing of the show is from 6 pm to 7pm. You have to arrive early to get the best seat may be around 5pm. It has a good sunset view too.
review 3: Wow! Amazing experience! Recommend this one over Uluwatu Temple as this is much less stressful & less busy but just as stunning & doesn't sell out as fast! Melasti beach is the perfect backdrop for such an incredible dance ü•∞
review 4: Really enjoyed the Kecak Dance here! A beautiful back drop and awesome performance for a decent price. I got my ticket early (2 hours before the show) which meant I didn't have to wait in line and got a seat I liked. Wasn't too busy that you felt squashed.
review 5:
Good performance, but there was only one guy with the voice over for all performers.

Awesome view and vibe with ocean wave as a background, get the very top seat for a better view.

Super crowded parking lot after the show.

name: Southernmost Point Of Bali Island
address: Unnamed Road, 5526+2M3, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia
review 1:
A good view point for Bali sunset.
Tip: This location could get real crowded. For an unobstructed view and less people, you can go to 2 different spots from here.
1. The cliff. Pass the parking, follow the road to the cliff where you can have broader view.
2. Find White rock bar, enter the public beach from the parking lot. I think the beach is called Melasti. You‚Äôll have a lot more quite spot to admire the beautiful sunset.
review 2: Stage live concert 10th World Water Forum
review 3: Nice view from here, nothing much in the area (probably covid aftershock) now, but a few cafes/restaurants/beach clubs are under construction/remodeling, so probably will be better soonish.
review 4:
Visiting the Southernmost Point of Bali Island was an unforgettable experience. The location is stunning - perched atop a cliff with panoramic views of the ocean and surrounding coastline. The scenery alone is worth the trip!

The area is well-maintained and has a few small cafes and shops selling souvenirs and snacks. It's a great place to relax and take in the views. The iconic Bali sign is also located here, which makes for a great photo opportunity.

The staff were friendly and helpful, providing information about the area and the best viewpoints for photos. The overall atmosphere was peaceful and serene.

I would highly recommend a visit to the Southernmost Point of Bali Island. It's a must-see for anyone visiting Bali, and is sure to leave you with lasting memories.
review 5: The point itself is not that special, but the surrounding area is beautiful.

name: Tebing Panorama Melasti Beach (Tebing Kembar)
address: 5527+P89, Ungasan, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia
review 1:
I can call this place is home for beach lover. I went to White Rock Beach Club beach area & resting near the rock.

The wave was big super cold water. Never experienced it before.

Definitely will come again.

Entrance fee 9,000 idr per person.
review 2: Naturally beautiful beach on the southern tip of Bali Peninsula

name: Melasti Beach
address: Melasti beach, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: It's nice to visit here but when I visited this beach, there were windy and high waves so I couldn't enjoy near the beach... offer all is very nice
review 2: Melasti Beach: A Bali Gem with Pristine Sands. The crystal-clear waters and unspoiled coastline create a tranquil haven. It's an ideal spot for relaxation and enjoying the beauty of Bali's natural landscapes. Unwind at Melasti Beach.
review 3:
Melasti Beach is a good beach where to swim, both low than high tide.
But there is a big problem, Grab-drivers are not allowed to enter the beach level (the road and the entrance ticket counter is on the hill, and it is very steep and high) to pick-up (only drop-off). There are a lot of illegal taxi drivers there, people not authorised that spend all the day there waiting for the moment tourists face the impossibility to go away, and there are a few authorised taxi drivers, but they don't use taximeter but they brag fixed rate (to reach the pick of the hill is 100k). I hope this mafia will be stopped soon.

name: Warung Anis
address: Jl. Pantai Green Bowl Jl. Pura Batu Pageh, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: Best Warung at Green Ball. Super friendly family taking care of the food and yourself! If you plan to surf - easy and friendly they will take care of your bag. Their coconuts after surf are always fresh and served with a big smile! Big Food portions, their nasi goreng is delicious. I can‚Äôt recommend more this place! Best service.
review 2: One of the best nasi gorengs I have had in whole Bali. It looked so good I forgot to take a picture. Their home-made chili sauce is just as heartwarming as their hospitality, and all that for a really fair price ü•∞
review 3: We ate lunch here. Was very delicious, big plates and this all for a cheap price. Extremly friendly staff and beautiful location next to the stairs going down to the Greenbow Beach! We can highly recommend this place :)
review 4: A wonderful place to take luncheon; the portions are big and everything‚Äòs very fairly priced. The owner is one of the most heartwarming women I‚Äòve ever met. One of the highlights of my trip to Bali!
review 5:
The welcome was excellent, and we had a very decent lunch at a very reasonable price!

The hosts are very welcoming and friendly !
